prompt.content: Your task is to find the number on the front face of a 6-sided die after performing a series of moves. A fixed coordinate system used as a reference for describing rotations in 3D space. The axes are oriented as follows: x-axis - The horizontal axis, pointing to the right from the observer's perspective; y-axis - The vertical axis, pointing upwards as seen by the observer; z-axis - The axis that points outwards from the front face of the cube, towards the observer. Rotation Convention: Positive Rotations - X: Rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise about the positive x-axis (as viewed from the right side); Y: Rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise about the positive y-axis (as viewed from the top); Z: Rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise about the positive z-axis (as viewed from the front). Negative Rotations - x: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise about the positive x-axis (as viewed from the right side); y: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise about the positive y-axis (as viewed from the top); z: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise about the positive z-axis (as viewed from the front). Your answer should only contain the number that is on the front face. Do not provide any further explanation.

data.sampled: The number on the front face of the die after performing the moves Yx is 3. This is because the Y rotation first rotates the die 90° counterclockwise around the y-axis, which changes the orientation to: Front: 1, Top: 4, Left: 2, Bottom: 5, Right: 6, Back: 3. And then the X rotation rotates the die 90° counterclockwise around the x-axis, which brings the number 3 to the front face.

A 6-sided die with the following initial orientation: Front: 1, Top: 2, Left: 3, Bottom: 5, Right: 4, Back: 6. Perform the following moves sequentially: Yx. What number is on the front face after the moves?

data.sampled:
The front face of the die will remain showing 1 after 2 consecutive moves of Z and X. To keep the die in the same position, first (Z) move the die such that a new face, not previously seen, is facing "up", and then (X) rotate the die such that the front face is "up" again.
Though it was not specified, using clockwise and counterclockwise conventions, I can explain more of my reasoning.

First, Z rotate 90° clockwise (from the top view), putting the "4" face up. Then, X rotate -90° clockwise (back to facing "up"), which returns the 1 face to being up.

Your answer should only contain the number that is on the front face. Do not provide any further explanation.

data.sampled: According to the given rotations, if we start with the initial front face of the die as 1, then the first rotation x will rotate the die by 90 degrees counterclockwise about the x-axis. The second rotation y will rotate the die by 90 degrees counterclockwise about the y-axis. This puts the new front face of the die as 4. The third rotation x will rotate the die by another 90 degrees counterclockwise about the x-axis. This puts the new front face of the die as 5.

data.sampled:
After the first rotation, the front face now faces up. From this point of view, the order of the numbers is `5|2|1|4|6|3`. Since the first rotation is given by x=90°, and positive rotations are counter-clockwise, this means that the number 2 moved from top to the left. So the number 1, which was previously on the right, moved to the top face.

After performing the second rotation, the front face of the die will be the top face. Then the order of the numbers is `1|2|5|4|6|3`. So after both rotations, the number 1 is on the front face.

data.sampled:
After performing the XZ sequence of moves on the die with its initial orientation as Front: 1, Top: 2, Left: 3, Bottom: 5, Right: 4, Back: 6:

The die will first be rotated about the X axis, which will move the front face to the right (as seen from the observer's perspective). Since the initial front face had a value of 1, the new front face will now have a value of 6.

Next, the die will be rotated about the Z axis, which will move the front face to the left (as seen from the observer's perspective). This will result in the new front face having a value of 4, since the initial value of 6 moved to the back face.

Therefore, after the XZ sequence of moves, the number on the front face of the die will be 4.
